instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (SMC rework return)
threads.message:
I had a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> return bite me today.  It came back with no MagSafe light.  The original repair was trace repair around LVDS and SMC rework.    Usually before I remove a SMC when I have a SMC problem that is not a short in the SMC I heat it until it reflows and bump it a little to jiggle the balls and that fixes it.  I have had a few of these come back and if I jiggle it again and reflow it works.  This time I pulled the SMC and noticed a oxidized pad that was grey on the SMC.  I cleaned and touched up that pad and reflowed the chip.  It is working once again but I am not sure I trust it.

Have you seen this before and what is your usual repair when this is encountered?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (SMC rework return)
threads.message: ALWAYS reball SMC, if reacts at heat!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (SMC rework return)
threads.message: I usually just reflow it, but if it comes back, it is always replaced. I don't even reball them rather rule out bad chip being heated at that point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (SMC rework return)
threads.message:
I reflow them and 9 out of 10 times I never see the machine again.  Since most of the machines I work on are school contracts if it went bad I would see it again.  I may start pulling each one and checking for grey pads instead of just reflowing.  

I don't have any more donor boards with a SMC on them! I only have a hand full of donor boars and they are badly raped.  Where is a good source for them?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (SMC rework return)
threads.message: Exactly same for me. I get donors from Ali Express or a source in China most of the time

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (SMC rework return)
threads.message: Source for scrap boards already posted on the forum; with contacts on eBay and Skype...
